title: Baggage JSON Functional Library
description: The common definitions from the Baggage domain that can be reused in Baggage standard schemas

Agency.title: Agency
Agency.description: An organization which acts on behalf of another.

AgencyCodeEnum.title: Agency Code
AgencyCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA handling agency organizations.

Agent.title: Agent
Agent.description: A Role of an individual person to be a staff of an agency.

agency.title: Each Agent must be employed by one and only one Agency
agency.description: An organization which acts on behalf of another.

agentIdentifier.title: Agent.Agent Identifier
agentIdentifier.description: Identifier of an agent as assigned by his/her agency.

individual.title: Each Agent must can be one and only one Individual
individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

AirlineBagRefIdentifier.title: Airline Bag Reference_ Identifier
AirlineBagRefIdentifier.description: Baggage identifier used for internal usage only (typically used as Julian date on 3 numeric) Example: 100 (100th Julian day)

AirlineDesigCode.title: Airline Designator_ Code
AirlineDesigCode.description: Either the IATA-defined 2-character code or the ICAO-defined 3-character code of an airline, as per the length of the value.

AirlineDesigCodeEnum.title: Airline Designator Code
AirlineDesigCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Resolution 762 airline codes, or of ICAO airline codes.

Bag.title: Bag
Bag.description: A piece of luggage associated with a passenger, packed for traveling, and necessary or appropriate in connection with a journey.

bagTag.title: Each Bag must has one and only one Bag Tag
bagTag.description: A small piece of paper, fabric, plastic or similar material attached to an bag and giving information about it.

dimensions.title: Each Bag may have one and only one Bag Dimensions
dimensions.description: A set of measurable extents of a particular bag, such as length, or height or width.

owner.title: Each Bag may be owned by one and only one Individual
owner.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

physicalProperties.title: Each Bag may have one and only one Bag Physical Properties
physicalProperties.description: A set of properties used to characterize a bag, such as weight, color.

BagBasicCode.title: Bag Basic_ Code
BagBasicCode.description: The bag basic code of the physical property measurement

BagBasicCodeEnum.title: Bag Basic Code
BagBasicCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Resolution 743b Attachment a basic codes

BagColorCode.title: Bag Color_ Code
BagColorCode.description: The bag color code of the physical property measurement

BagColorCodeEnum.title: Bag Color Code
BagColorCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Resolution 743b Attachment a color codes

BagDeleteRequestInd.title: Bag Delete Request_ Indicator
BagDeleteRequestInd.description: A request by the airline to delete or mark as deleted the record for this bag as no longer expected for the flight.

BagDimensions.title: Bag Dimensions
BagDimensions.description: A set of measurable extents of a particular bag, such as length, or height or width.

heightMeasure.title: Bag Dimensions.Height Measure
heightMeasure.description: A measurement or extent of something from end to end

lengthMeasure.title: Bag Dimensions.Length Measure
lengthMeasure.description: A measurement or extent of something from end to end

widthMeasure.title: Bag Dimensions.Width Measure
widthMeasure.description: A measurement or extent of something from end to end

BagExternalFeatureCode.title: Bag External Feature_ Code
BagExternalFeatureCode.description: The bag external feature code of the physical property measurement

BagExternalFeatureCodeEnum.title: Bag External Feature Code
BagExternalFeatureCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Resolution 743b Attachment a external feature codes

BaggageEvent.title: Baggage Event
BaggageEvent.description: A thing that happens in context of baggage logistics. That is a completion and / or commencement of a change, or the outcome of a change, or the arrival of a pre-determined point in time. Specifically, not a thing that takes place.

actualDateTime.title: Baggage Event.Actual Date Time
actualDateTime.description: Actual date and time of the activity.

eventTriggerCode.title: Baggage Event.Event Trigger Code
eventTriggerCode.description: Event Trigger Qualifier as per RP1745 section 2 .R Augmented Internal Airline Data

facility.title: Each Baggage Event must takes place at one and only one Facility
facility.description: An infrastructure (such as an airfield) that is built, installed, or established to serve a particular purpose Examples: an aircraft stand, a baggage cart, a gate, a high loader

informedProcess.title: Each Trigger must initiate one and only one Trigger
informedProcess.description: A series of tasks or steps taken in order to achieve a particular end in the context of baggage logistics.

outcomeOfProcess.title: Each Baggage Event may be the result of one and only one Baggage Process
outcomeOfProcess.description: A series of tasks or steps taken in order to achieve a particular end in the context of baggage logistics.

scanner.title: Each Baggage Event may is observed by one and only one Scanner
scanner.description: A device that scans objects and converts them into or extracts digital data. E.g. document scanner, barcode reader, biometric scanner.

BaggageFacilityType.title: Baggage Facility Type
BaggageFacilityType.description: A classification of Facility according to Facility Type

baggageFacilityTypeCode.title: Baggage Facility Type.Baggage Facility Type Code

BaggageFacilityTypeCode.title: Baggage Facility Type_ Code
BaggageFacilityTypeCode.description: A code is a character string of letters, numbers, special characters (except escape sequences), and symbols. This code classifies bag handling locations (subset of all locations)

BaggageFacilityTypeCodeEnum.title: Baggage Facility Type Code
BaggageFacilityTypeCodeEnum.description: PSCRM edition 44 RP1745-Annex 3.1 Additional Recommended Codes for Check in Location Identifier RP1745-Annex 5.1 Location Categories

BaggageIncident.title: Baggage Incident
BaggageIncident.description: An Event that occurs spontaneously about a bag, and to which the organization is required to respond.

BaggageProcess.title: Baggage Process
BaggageProcess.description: A series of tasks or steps taken in order to achieve a particular end in the context of baggage logistics.

agent.title: Each Baggage Process may be participated by one or more Agents
agent.description: A Role of an individual person to be a staff of an agency.

baggageEvent.title: Each Baggage Process must one and only one Baggage Event
baggageEvent.description: A thing that happens in context of baggage logistics. That is a completion and / or commencement of a change, or the outcome of a change, or the arrival of a pre-determined point in time. Specifically, not a thing that takes place.

baggageProcessCode.title: Baggage Process.Baggage Process Code
baggageProcessCode.description: Top level baggage process name. Distinguishes between Local departing baggage (L), Transfer arriving baggage (F), Transfer departing baggage (T), and Terminating arriving baggage (X)

baggageSubProcessCode.title: Baggage Process.Baggage Sub Process Code
baggageSubProcessCode.description: Secondary level baggage process naming Follows baggage journey (bag, cart, ULD)

baggageSubSubProcessCode.title: Baggage Process.Baggage Sub Sub Process Code
baggageSubSubProcessCode.description: Tertiary level of baggage process identification Reports the task level

BaggageProcessCode.title: Baggage Process_ Code
BaggageProcessCode.description: The baggage process code of the process interaction

BaggageProcessCodeEnum.title: Baggage Process Code
BaggageProcessCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Recommendation 1745 Attachment A Process Source Indicator Codes Valid Values: F - Arrivals (transfering) Process; L - Departing Process; T - Transfering Process (Departure); X - Arrivals (Terminating) Process

BaggageStatuses.title: Baggage Statuses
BaggageStatuses.description: A set of statuses of baggage at a particular time in a process.

conformanceStateCode.title: Baggage Statuses.Conformance State Code
conformanceStateCode.description: Expresses conformance enforcements over the baggage item closed, sealed, screened, inspected, verified, reconciled

controlStateCode.title: Baggage Statuses.Control State Code
controlStateCode.description: Expresses control over the baggage item

BaggageSubProcessCode.title: Baggage Sub Process_ Code
BaggageSubProcessCode.description: The baggage sub processcode of the process interaction

BaggageSubProcessCodeEnum.title: Baggage Sub Process Code
BaggageSubProcessCodeEnum.description: To be named Valid Values: Acquire - Acquire from bagdrop or transfer; Deliver - Deliver step to passenger, or to transfer airline; Inspect - Inspection by customs step; Load - Loading step; Package - Packaging Step; Screen - Screening step; Unload - Unloading step

BaggageSubSubProcessCode.title: Baggage Sub Sub Process_ Code
BaggageSubSubProcessCode.description: The baggage sub sub process code of the process interaction

BaggageSubSubProcessCodeEnum.title: Baggage Sub Sub Process Code
BaggageSubSubProcessCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Baggage XML Baggage Sub Sub Process Codes

BaggageTypeCode.title: Baggage Type_ Code
BaggageTypeCode.description: The baggage type code of the physical property measurement

BaggageTypeCodeEnum.title: Baggage Type Code
BaggageTypeCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Resolution 743b Attachment A: Baggage Types

BagMaterialCode.title: Bag Material_ Code
BagMaterialCode.description: The bag material code of the physical property measurement

BagMaterialCodeEnum.title: Bag Material Code
BagMaterialCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Resolution 743b Attachment a. material codes

BagPhysicalProperties.title: Bag Physical Properties
BagPhysicalProperties.description: A set of properties used to characterize a bag, such as weight, color.

baggageTypeCode.title: Bag Physical Properties.Baggage Type Code
baggageTypeCode.description: Descriptive code of the physical property measurement. Refer to resolution 743b baggage type codes.

basicCode.title: Bag Physical Properties.Basic Code
basicCode.description: Basic code of the physical property measurement. Refer to resolution 743b basic element codes.

colorCode.title: Bag Physical Properties.Color Code
colorCode.description: Color of the physical property measurement. Refer to resolution 743b color codes.

descriptivePictureUri.title: Bag Physical Properties.Descriptive Picture URI
descriptivePictureUri.description: Descriptive picture of physical property measurement.

externalFeatureCode.title: Bag Physical Properties.External Feature Code
externalFeatureCode.description: External feature of the physical property measurement. Refer to resolution 743b external element codes.

materialCode.title: Bag Physical Properties.Material Code
materialCode.description: Material code of the physical property measurement. Refer to resolution 743b description codes.

weightAllowanceMeasure.title: Bag Physical Properties.Weight Allowance Measure
weightAllowanceMeasure.description: Allowance for Weight for a single Bag

weightMeasure.title: Bag Physical Properties.Weight Measure
weightMeasure.description: A measurement of the heaviness of a bag. Only checked weight supported.

BagRemovalRequestInd.title: Bag Removal Request_ Indicator
BagRemovalRequestInd.description: An indicator set by the airline to unload a loaded bag, Should be set with the authorization to load set to NO.

BagSegment.title: Bag Segment
BagSegment.description: An allocation of a bag to a specific set of consecutive legs and a load position in vehicle performing the legs

bag.title: Each Bag Segment must refers to one and only one Bag
bag.description: A piece of luggage associated with a passenger, packed for traveling, and necessary or appropriate in connection with a journey.

baggageProcess.title: Each Bag Segment must be subject of one and only one Baggage Process
baggageProcess.description: A series of tasks or steps taken in order to achieve a particular end in the context of baggage logistics.

baggageState.title: Each Bag Segment may results in one and only one Baggage Statuses
baggageState.description: A set of statuses of baggage at a particular time in a process.

carryingSegment.title: Each Bag Segment must is part of one and only one Dated Operating Segment
carryingSegment.description: An operation between board point and any subsequent off point within the same flight designator. Could be one or more legs. Could also be used for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

classOfService.title: Each Bag Segment may have one and only one RBD
classOfService.description: A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. For example: 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Discounted.

classOfServiceCode.title: Bag Segment.Class Of Service Code
classOfServiceCode.description: Code used to identify a particular Reservations Booking Designator. For example: P, J, W, M.

collection.title: Each Bag Segment may is in one and only one Collection
collection.description: A collection reports when an item is (planned to be) collected at a facility potentially using a vehicle

delivery.title: Each Bag Segment may is in one and only one Delivery
delivery.description: A delivery reports when an item is (planned to be) delivered at a facility potentially using a vehicle

exception.title: Each Bag Segment may is refering to one or more Bag Segment Exceptions
exception.description: Baggage Exception as per RP1745 Attachment A Section 1

holdCompartment.title: Each Bag Segment may load in one and only one Hold Compartment
holdCompartment.description: A space designated within a hold that can be containerized/palletized or not.

internalAirlineData.title: Bag Segment.Internal Airline Data
internalAirlineData.description: For airline to determine its use and meaning in extension of standard

loadSeqOrdinal.title: Bag Segment.Load Sequence Ordinal
loadSeqOrdinal.description: This is the sequence number in which the baggage item was loaded into the stowage device.

loyaltyProgramAccount.title: Each Bag Segment may be handled according to one and only one Loyalty Program Account
loyaltyProgramAccount.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

packIntoCart.title: Each Bag Segment may pack into one and only one Cart Ride
packIntoCart.description: A use of a baggage cart to package a collection of bags of same segregation for transport between terminal and aircraft stand

packIntoUld.title: Each Bag Segment may pack into one and only one ULD Allocation
packIntoUld.description: An allocation of a ULD to a specific set of legs and a load position in vehicle performing the legs

segmentSecurityControls.title: Each Bag Segment may have one and only one Segment Security Controls
segmentSecurityControls.description: A set of principles or procedures according to which something is done on a particular segment of travel.

segmentSecurityOutcomes.title: Each Bag Segment may has one and only one Segment Security Outcomes
segmentSecurityOutcomes.description: A set of outcomes of applying Segment Security Controls to Baggage Process

BagSegmentException.title: Bag Segment Exception
BagSegmentException.description: Baggage Exception as per RP1745 Attachment A Section 1

exceptionCode.title: Bag Segment Exception.Exception Code
exceptionCode.description: Exception code of the exception control. An exception control is a item that is excluded from a general statement or does not follow a rule.

BagTag.title: Bag Tag
BagTag.description: A small piece of paper, fabric, plastic or similar material attached to an bag and giving information about it.

airlineBagRefIdentifier.title: Bag Tag.Airline Bag Reference Identifier
airlineBagRefIdentifier.description: Baggage identifier used for internal usage only (typically used as Julian date on 3 numeric)

issuerCode.title: Bag Tag.Issuer Code
issuerCode.description: Baggage tag issuer codes, combined with the tag serial number, are used to identify each piece of checked luggage through all baggage handling processes. Refer to Resolution 769 Bag Tag Issuer Codes

issuingAgency.title: Each Bag Tag may be used by one and only one Agency
issuingAgency.description: An organization which acts on behalf of another.

issuingAgent.title: Each Bag Tag may be issued by one and only one Agent
issuingAgent.description: A Role of an individual person to be a staff of an agency.

printer.title: Each Bag Tag may be printed by one and only one Printer
printer.description: A device for printing text or pictures or barcodes, especially one linked to a computer.

scanningAgent.title: Each Bag Tag may be scanned one and only one Agent
scanningAgent.description: A Role of an individual person to be a staff of an agency.

serialNumberIdentifier.title: Bag Tag.Serial Number Identifier
serialNumberIdentifier.description: With Bag Tag Serial Number Code a Bag Tag Issuer may identify bags of her interest. See Resolution 740 Interline Bag Tag

transponderIdentifier.title: Bag Tag.Transponder Identifier
transponderIdentifier.description: Unique Transponder identifier, known as TID for Transponder identification

usageCode.title: Bag Tag.Usage Code
usageCode.description: With Bag Tag Usage Code a Bag Tag Issuer may differentiate use of the tag. See Resolution 740 Section 3 Use of Tags

BagTagIssuerCode.title: Bag Tag Issuer_ Code
BagTagIssuerCode.description: Baggage tag issuer codes, combined with the tag serial number, are used to identify each piece of checked luggage through all baggage handling processes

BagTagIssuerCodeEnum.title: Bag Tag Issuer Code
BagTagIssuerCodeEnum.description: Baggage tag issuer codes, combined with the tag serial number, are used to identify each piece of checked luggage through all baggage handling processes

BagTagSerialNumberIdentifier.title: Bag Tag Serial Number_ Identifier
BagTagSerialNumberIdentifier.description: With Bag Tag Serial Number Code a Bag Tag Issuer may identify bags of her interest. See Resolution 740 Interline Bag Tag

BagTagStatusCode.title: Bag Tag Status_ Code
BagTagStatusCode.description: Determines whether bag is authorized to load

BagTagStatusCodeEnum.title: Bag Tag Status Code
BagTagStatusCodeEnum.description: Determines whether bag is authorized to load Valid Values: A - Active; I - Inactive; V - Validated

BagTagUsageCode.title: Bag Tag Usage_ Code
BagTagUsageCode.description: With Bag Tag Usage Code a Bag Tag Issuer may differentiate use of the tag. See Resolution 740 Section 3 Use of Tags

BagTagUsageCodeEnum.title: Bag Tag Usage Code
BagTagUsageCodeEnum.description: With Bag Tag Usage Code a Bag Tag Issuer may differentiate use of the tag. See Resolution 740 Section 3 Use of Tags

BoardingStatusCode.title: Boarding Status_ Code
BoardingStatusCode.description: The boarding status code of the individual party status

BoardingStatusCodeEnum.title: Boarding Status Code
BoardingStatusCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Recommendation 1745 Attachment a baggage status codes for Boarding status. Valid Values: B - Passenger boarded.; C - Passenger checked-in.; N - Passenger not checked-in.; S - Passenger on standby

bookingIdentifier.title: Booking.Booking Identifier
bookingIdentifier.description: Booking reference Identifier, also called Record Locator (6 characters).

bookingRefCompanyCode.title: Booking.Booking Reference Company Code
bookingRefCompanyCode.description: Code of company having issued the booking reference identifier.

BookingRefCompanyCode.title: Booking Reference Company_ Code
BookingRefCompanyCode.description: Code of company having issued the booking reference identifier.

BookingRefIdentifier.title: Booking Reference_ Identifier
BookingRefIdentifier.description: Booking reference Identifier, also called Record Locator (6 characters).

CarriageMediumCode.title: Carriage Medium_ Code
CarriageMediumCode.description: The usage category code of the transport

CarriageMediumCodeEnum.title: Carriage Medium Code
CarriageMediumCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Recommendation 1745 Attachment a carriage medium codes Valid Values: AV - Airline VAN; CO - Courier Van; CR - Car Rental VAN; CS - Cruise Ship; HV - Hotel VAN; RA - Rail

Carrier.title: Carrier
Carrier.description: An organization operating transport vehicles for commercial purposes which offers transport services, both scheduled or non-scheduled, to the public for carriage of passengers and their baggage, mail and/or cargo and is certified for such purposes by an authority of the state in which it is established.

carrierDesigCode.title: Carrier.Carrier Designator Code
carrierDesigCode.description: ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code assigned to the carrier. For example: BA is British Airways PLC, 2C is SNCF and is also CMA CGM Air Cargo.

duplicateDesigInd.title: Carrier.Duplicate Designator Indicator
duplicateDesigInd.description: Indicates that the carrier designator code is a duplicate code shared by multiple carriers. In this case to uniquely identify the carrier the carrier name must be specified in addition to the carrier designator code.

Cart.title: Cart
Cart.description: A cart may be used to transport baggage or cargo over the airport has wheels, offers a platform, has towing interface see AHM 963: FUNCTIONAL SPECIFICATION FOR A BAGGAGE/CARGO CART

cartType.title: Each Cart may be qualified by one and only one Cart Type
cartType.description: A qualification of a Cart as BAGGAGE or CARGO CART see AHM 963: FUNCTIONAL SPECIFICATION FOR A BAGGAGE/CARGO CART

CartRide.title: Cart Ride
CartRide.description: A use of a baggage cart to package a collection of bags of same segregation for transport between terminal and aircraft stand

baggageProcess.title: Each Cart Ride must be subject of one and only one Baggage Process
baggageProcess.description: A series of tasks or steps taken in order to achieve a particular end in the context of baggage logistics.

baggageState.title: Each Cart Ride may results in one and only one Baggage Statuses
baggageState.description: A set of statuses of baggage at a particular time in a process.

cart.title: Each Cart Ride must refers to one and only one Cart
cart.description: A cart may be used to transport baggage or cargo over the airport has wheels, offers a platform, has towing interface see AHM 963: FUNCTIONAL SPECIFICATION FOR A BAGGAGE/CARGO CART

classOfService.title: Each Cart Ride may have one and only one RBD
classOfService.description: A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. For example: 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Discounted.

classOfServiceCode.title: Cart Ride.Class Of Service Code
classOfServiceCode.description: Code used to identify a particular RBD. For example: P, J, W, M.

collection.title: Each Cart Ride may is in one and only one Collection
collection.description: A collection reports when an item is (planned to be) collected at a facility potentially using a vehicle

commodityCode.title: Cart Ride.Commodity Code
commodityCode.description: Code set used with ULDs for segregation of bags and/or cargo for efficient load and unload from the aircraft and subsequent ground operations. Load information codes, known also as commodity codes, are defined by but not limited to IATA Load Control - AHM 510, 1.1.

delivery.title: Each Cart Ride may is in one and only one Delivery
delivery.description: A delivery reports when an item is (planned to be) delivered at a facility potentially using a vehicle

holdCompartment.title: Each Cart Ride may one and only one Hold Compartment
holdCompartment.description: A space designated within a hold that can be containerized/palletized or not.

transportArrival.title: Each Cart Ride must support one and only one Transport Arrival
transportArrival.description: An action or process of arriving of a transport vehicle in any place or location. Superseded by Aircraft Arrival.

transportDep.title: Each Cart Ride must support one and only one Transport Departure
transportDep.description: An action or process of leaving of a transport vehicle from any place or location. Superseded by Aircraft Departure.

CartType.title: Cart Type
CartType.description: A qualification of a Cart as BAGGAGE or CARGO CART see AHM 963: FUNCTIONAL SPECIFICATION FOR A BAGGAGE/CARGO CART

cartTypeCode.title: Cart Type.Cart Type Code
cartTypeCode.description: A qualification of a Cart as BAGGAGE or CARGO CART see AHM 963: FUNCTIONAL SPECIFICATION FOR A BAGGAGE/CARGO CART

CartTypeCode.title: Cart Type_ Code
CartTypeCode.description: A qualification of a Cart as BAGGAGE or CARGO CART see AHM 963: FUNCTIONAL SPECIFICATION FOR A BAGGAGE/CARGO CART

CartTypeCodeEnum.title: Cart Type Code
CartTypeCodeEnum.description: A qualification of a Cart as BAGGAGE or CARGO CART see AHM 963: FUNCTIONAL SPECIFICATION FOR A BAGGAGE/CARGO CART Valid Values: Baggage - Cart used to transport baggage; Cargo - Cart to use for moving cargo

ChangeIndCode.title: Change Indicator_ Code
ChangeIndCode.description: The change indicator code of the bag movement

City.title: City
City.description: A City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address, or metropolitan area)

cityName.title: City.City Name
cityName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the city, town or village.

Code.title: Code
Code.description: A code is a character string of letters, numbers, special characters (except escape sequences), and symbols.

Collection.title: Collection
Collection.description: A collection reports when an item is (planned to be) collected at a facility potentially using a vehicle

earliestDateTime.title: Collection.Earliest Date Time
earliestDateTime.description: Earliest or targetted time for collection

facility.title: Each Collection may from one and only one Facility
facility.description: An infrastructure (such as an airfield) that is built, installed, or established to serve a particular purpose Examples: an aircraft stand, a baggage cart, a gate, a high loader

surfaceTransportVehicle.title: Each Collection may using one and only one Surface Transport Vehicle
surfaceTransportVehicle.description: A means used for transporting people or goods, on land or water. E.g. train, bus, van, ship.

CommodityCode.title: Commodity_ Code
CommodityCode.description: Code set used with ULDs for segregation of bags and/or cargo for efficient load and unload from the aircraft and subsequent ground operations. Load information codes, known also as commodity codes, are defined by but not limited to IATA Load Control - AHM 510, 1.1.

ContainerHandlingTypeText.title: Container Handling Type_ Text
ContainerHandlingTypeText.description: Free text field up to 8 characters

CrewMember.title: Crew Member
CrewMember.description: A Role of an individual person to be a member of a crew.

carrier.title: Each Crew Member may be engaged by one and only one Carrier
carrier.description: An organization operating transport vehicles for commercial purposes which offers transport services, both scheduled or non-scheduled, to the public for carriage of passengers and their baggage, mail and/or cargo and is certified for such purposes by an authority of the state in which it is established.

crewMemberIdentifier.title: Crew Member.Crew Member Identifier
crewMemberIdentifier.description: Identifier of a crew member as assigned by the airline.

Date.title: Date
Date.description: A date is a Gregorian calendar representation in various common resolutions: year, month, week, day.

DatedMarketingSegment.title: Dated Marketing Segment
DatedMarketingSegment.description: A commercial designation under which a Dated Operating Segment can be booked, either under the operating carrier's designator or that of another carrier (codeshare).

carrier.title: Each Dated Marketing Segment must is marketed by one and only one Carrier
carrier.description: An organization operating transport vehicles for commercial purposes which offers transport services, both scheduled or non-scheduled, to the public for carriage of passengers and their baggage, mail and/or cargo and is certified for such purposes by an authority of the state in which it is established.

datedMarketingSegmentIdentifier.title: Dated Marketing Segment.Dated Marketing Segment Identifier
datedMarketingSegmentIdentifier.description: Identifier of a Dated Marketing Segment.

datedOperatingSegment.title: Each Dated Marketing Segment must marketed as one and only one Dated Operating Segment
datedOperatingSegment.description: An operation between board point and any subsequent off point within the same flight designator. Could be one or more legs. Could also be used for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

funnelFlightInd.title: Dated Marketing Segment.Funnel Flight Indicator
funnelFlightInd.description: Use of a single flight number for an itinerary that actually involves an online connection with two separate flight numbers, with the presumed intent to make the itinerary appear to be a direct flight with a change of aircraft as opposed to a connection.

marketingCarrierFlightNumberText.title: Dated Marketing Segment.Marketing Carrier Flight Number Text
marketingCarrierFlightNumberText.description: Numerical designation of a flight as it is marketed by a carrier.

operationalSuffixText.title: Dated Marketing Segment.Operational Suffix Text
operationalSuffixText.description: An operational suffix used to distinguish two flights having the same flight number and departing from their respective Origin Stations on the same date.

DatedOperatingFlight.title: Dated Operating Flight
DatedOperatingFlight.description: An operation of one or more Dated Legs in a specified sequence, with the same flight designator. Could use a flight number for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

administratingCarrierFlightNumberText.title: Dated Operating Flight.Administrating Carrier Flight Number Text

flightIdentifierDate.title: Dated Operating Flight.Flight Identifier Date
flightIdentifierDate.description: (UTC) date of the scheduled aircraft departure from the station of origin.

operatingCarrier.title: Each Dated Operating Flight must be operated by one and only one Carrier
operatingCarrier.description: An organization operating transport vehicles for commercial purposes which offers transport services, both scheduled or non-scheduled, to the public for carriage of passengers and their baggage, mail and/or cargo and is certified for such purposes by an authority of the state in which it is established.

operationalSuffixText.title: Dated Operating Flight.Operational Suffix Text
operationalSuffixText.description: from SIX XSD: Alphabetical character following a flight number assigned for operational purposes. SSIM: A code assigned by the administrating carrier for operational purposes.

DatedOperatingLeg.title: Dated Operating Leg
DatedOperatingLeg.description: A nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc. Superseded by Flight Leg.

datedOperatingFlight.title: Each Dated Operating Leg must be part of one and only one Dated Operating Flight
datedOperatingFlight.description: An operation of one or more Dated Legs in a specified sequence, with the same flight designator. Could use a flight number for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

datedOperatingLegIdentifier.title: Dated Operating Leg.Dated Operating Leg Identifier
datedOperatingLegIdentifier.description: Uniquely identifies a leg within the context of one message.

onwardLeg.title: Each Previous Leg may be followed by one or more Previous Legs
onwardLeg.description: A nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc. Superseded by Flight Leg.

DatedOperatingSegment.title: Dated Operating Segment
DatedOperatingSegment.description: An operation between board point and any subsequent off point within the same flight designator. Could be one or more legs. Could also be used for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

datedOperatingFlight.title: Each Dated Operating Segment must be delivered by one and only one Dated Operating Flight
datedOperatingFlight.description: An operation of one or more Dated Legs in a specified sequence, with the same flight designator. Could use a flight number for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

datedOperatingLeg.title: Each Dated Operating Segment may be implemented by one or more Dated Operating Legs
datedOperatingLeg.description: A nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc. Superseded by Flight Leg.

datedOperatingSegmentIdentifier.title: Dated Operating Segment.Dated Operating Segment Identifier
datedOperatingSegmentIdentifier.description: Identifier of a Dated Operating Segment.

destStation.title: Each Destination must arrive at one and only one Destination
destStation.description: A Location or facility where air or surface transportation originates, stops and/or terminates, and where passengers and/or cargo can be taken on or off.

operatingCarrier.title: Each Dated Operating Segment must be operated by one and only one Carrier
operatingCarrier.description: An organization operating transport vehicles for commercial purposes which offers transport services, both scheduled or non-scheduled, to the public for carriage of passengers and their baggage, mail and/or cargo and is certified for such purposes by an authority of the state in which it is established.

operatingCarrierFlightNumberText.title: Dated Operating Segment.Operating Carrier Flight Number Text
operatingCarrierFlightNumberText.description: Numerical designation of a flight as it is operated by a carrier.

operationalSuffixText.title: Dated Operating Segment.Operational Suffix Text
operationalSuffixText.description: Used to distinguish two flights having the same flight number and departing from their respective Origin Stations on the same date.

originStation.title: Each Origin must depart from one and only one Origin
originStation.description: A Location or facility where air or surface transportation originates, stops and/or terminates, and where passengers and/or cargo can be taken on or off.

DateTime.title: Date Time
DateTime.description: A date time identifies a date and time of day to various common resolutions: year, month, week, day, hour, minute, second, and fraction of second.

Delivery.title: Delivery
Delivery.description: A delivery reports when an item is (planned to be) delivered at a facility potentially using a vehicle

earliestDateTime.title: Delivery.Earliest Date Time
earliestDateTime.description: Earliest or target time for delivery

facility.title: Each Delivery may to one and only one Facility
facility.description: An infrastructure (such as an airfield) that is built, installed, or established to serve a particular purpose Examples: an aircraft stand, a baggage cart, a gate, a high loader

surfaceTransportVehicle.title: Each Delivery may using one and only one Surface Transport Vehicle
surfaceTransportVehicle.description: A means used for transporting people or goods, on land or water. E.g. train, bus, van, ship.

EventTriggerCode.title: Event Trigger_ Code
EventTriggerCode.description: IATA RP1745 ch 2.3.21 Event Trigger Qualifier

EventTriggerCodeEnum.title: Event Trigger Code
EventTriggerCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA RP1745 ch 2.3.21 Event Trigger Qualifier

ExceptionCode.title: Exception_ Code
ExceptionCode.description: The code of the exception control

ExceptionCodeEnum.title: Exception Code
ExceptionCodeEnum.description: See IATA RP 1745 Attachment A 1.2 and 1.3 bag exception codes.

Facility.title: Facility
Facility.description: An infrastructure (such as an airfield) that is built, installed, or established to serve a particular purpose Examples: an aircraft stand, a baggage cart, a gate, a high loader

baggageFacilityType.title: Each Facility may be classified by one and only one Baggage Facility Type
baggageFacilityType.description: A classification of Facility according to Facility Type

facilityIdentifier.title: Facility.Facility Identifier
facilityIdentifier.description: Identifies facility according to local conventions

geospatialLocation.title: Each Facility may is located at one and only one Geospatial Location
geospatialLocation.description: A location with a spatial attribute, probably on the surface of the earth. For example: Longitude and Latitude

postalAddress.title: Each Facility may one and only one Postal Address
postalAddress.description: A natural or physical address used for postal service. May be a building address, airport address, etc.

station.title: Each Facility must is associated to one and only one Station
station.description: A Location or facility where air or surface transportation originates, stops and/or terminates, and where passengers and/or cargo can be taken on or off.

FlightNumberText.title: Flight Number_ Text
FlightNumberText.description: Identifies a flight number. 1 to 4 digits. May or may not have leading zeros when less than 4 digits. The use of leading zeros does not create a different Flight Number. For example, Flight Numbers 123 and 0123 are the same.

GeospatialLocation.title: Geospatial Location
GeospatialLocation.description: A location with a spatial attribute, probably on the surface of the earth. For example: Longitude and Latitude

pointElevationNumber.title: Geospatial Location.Point Elevation Number
pointElevationNumber.description: The number of the spatial location point elevation.

pointLatitudeNumber.title: Geospatial Location.Point Latitude Number
pointLatitudeNumber.description: The number of the spatial location point latitude.

pointLongitudeNumber.title: Geospatial Location.Point Longitude Number
pointLongitudeNumber.description: The number of the spatial location point longitude.

Hold.title: Hold
Hold.description: A space in an aircraft confined by ceiling, floor, walls and bulkhead, used for carrying load.

HoldCompartment.title: Hold Compartment
HoldCompartment.description: A space designated within a hold that can be containerized/palletized or not.

hold.title: Each Hold Compartment may be part of one and only one Hold
hold.description: A space in an aircraft confined by ceiling, floor, walls and bulkhead, used for carrying load.

holdCompartmentIdentifier.title: Hold Compartment.Hold Compartment Identifier
holdCompartmentIdentifier.description: Identifies a compartment within a hold (compartment no). As per AHM505, compartments are numbered from 1 to 6. A second figure can indicate a section in a compartment starting from the front to the back and from right to left.

holdIdentifier.title: Hold Compartment.Hold Identifier
holdIdentifier.description: Identifies a hold within a deck. Typical values include FWD (forward), AFT, BULK, MAIN (deck).

HoldCompartmentIdentifier.title: Hold Compartment_ Identifier
HoldCompartmentIdentifier.description: Identifies a Compartment. As per AHM505, compartments are numbered from the rear of the aircraft in descending order from 6 to 1. A second figure can indicate a section in a compartment starting from the front to the back and from right to left.

HoldIdentifier.title: Hold_ Identifier
HoldIdentifier.description: Specifies a Hold identifier (AFT, FWD, BULK)

IataLocationCode.title: IATA Location_ Code
IataLocationCode.description: Additional BDT to specify the codeset which defines the IATA airport or city codes.

IataLocationCodeEnum.title: IATA Location Code
IataLocationCodeEnum.description: Enumeration set for the Location Code BDT.

Identifier.title: Identifier
Identifier.description: An identifier is a character string used to uniquely identify one instance of an object within an identification scheme that is managed by an agency.

Ind.title: Indicator
Ind.description: An indicator is a list of two mutually exclusive Boolean values that express the only possible states of a property.

Individual.title: Individual
Individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

crewMember.title: Each Individual may can be one and only one Crew Member
crewMember.description: A Role of an individual person to be a member of a crew.

givenName.title: Individual.Given Name
givenName.description: A personal name given to the individual at birth and used before a family name. Also called first name. E.g. JOHN.

pax.title: Each Individual may can be one and only one Passenger
pax.description: A person except members of the crew carried or to be carried with the consent of the carrier, on board of any transport vehicle such as aircraft, train, bus, ship. Holds the attributes specific to a one booking, from shopping to fulfillment.

surname.title: Individual.Surname
surname.description: Individual's hereditary name(s) common to all members of a family. Also known as family name or last name. E.g. SMITH. Excludes any potential suffix.

titleName.title: Individual.Title Name
titleName.description: A word such as Mr., Mrs., Miss or Dr that is used before an individual's name to indicate the gender, profession or marital status.

InternalAirlineDataText.title: Internal Airline Data_ Text
InternalAirlineDataText.description: Free text field up to 59 characters

LengthMeasure.title: Length_ Measure
LengthMeasure.description: A numeric value determining a length (linear dimension) along with the specified unit of measure.

unitCode.title: Length_ Measure.Unit. Code
unitCode.description: The length unit code of measure.

value.title: Length_ Measure.Content
value.description: The integer value determining a length

LengthUnitCodeEnum.title: Length Unit Code
LengthUnitCodeEnum.description: List of Length Unit Codes. Subset of UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20. Valid Values: CMT - Centimeter; FOT - Foot; INH - Inch; MTR - Meter

LoyaltyProgramAccount.title: Loyalty Program Account
LoyaltyProgramAccount.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

Number.title: Number
Number.description: A mathematical number that is assigned or is determined by calculation.

OperationalSuffixText.title: Operational Suffix_ Text
OperationalSuffixText.description: Defines the Operational Suffix which is appended to a flight number.

Ordinal.title: Ordinal
Ordinal.description: An ordinal number is an assigned mathematical number that represents order or sequence.

Pax.title: Passenger
Pax.description: A person except members of the crew carried or to be carried with the consent of the carrier, on board of any transport vehicle such as aircraft, train, bus, ship. Holds the attributes specific to a one booking, from shopping to fulfillment.

booking.title: Each Passenger may has one and only one Booking

paxGroup.title: Each Passenger may can be part of one and only one Passenger Group
paxGroup.description: A number of individual passengers traveling under one commercial name that associates them. E.g. a Tour group or a group for sales allotment from airline to agency.

paxIdentifier.title: Passenger.Passenger Identifier
paxIdentifier.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger within the context of one message.

PaxGroup.title: Passenger Group
PaxGroup.description: A number of individual passengers traveling under one commercial name that associates them. E.g. a Tour group or a group for sales allotment from airline to agency.

intendedPaxQty.title: Passenger Group.Intended Passenger Quantity
intendedPaxQty.description: Intended number of passengers for this Group.

PaxSegment.title: Passenger Segment
PaxSegment.description: A transportation of a passenger on a Dated Operating Segment.

boardingStatusCode.title: Passenger Segment.Boarding Status Code
boardingStatusCode.description: The code of the passenger's boarding status.

checkInSeqNumber.title: Passenger Segment.Check In Sequence Number
checkInSeqNumber.description: This is the check in sequence number for a passenger on a passenger segment

seatAllocationExceptionCode.title: Passenger Segment.Seat Allocation Exception Code
seatAllocationExceptionCode.description: A code which identifies an exception to being able to allocate a seat to the passenger pre gate. Used in the boarding pass to optionally specify 'GATE' or 'STBY' if a seat has not been allocated. If a seat row and column have been specified then this attributes content would not be populated on the boarding pass.

seatIdentifier.title: Passenger Segment.Seat Identifier
seatIdentifier.description: The seat number of this service offer. Not filled in when jump seat, which is identified through the Baggage Segment Exception.

securityProfileStatusInd.title: Passenger Segment.Security Profile Status Indicator
securityProfileStatusInd.description: Indicates a passenger may be subject to more extensive security check and is at increased risk to no-show for flight.

segmentServiceOffer.title: Each Passenger Segment may qualify one and only one Segment Service Offer
segmentServiceOffer.description: An offer that applies to a particular segment of travel.

PostalAddress.title: Postal Address
PostalAddress.description: A natural or physical address used for postal service. May be a building address, airport address, etc.

buildingRoomText.title: Postal Address.Building Room Text
buildingRoomText.description: Additional address information including building name, room, apartment, or suite number.

city.title: Each Postal Address may have one and only one City
city.description: A City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address, or metropolitan area)

labelText.title: Postal Address.Label Text
labelText.description: Used to differentiate multiple Postal Addresses of one contact. For example: AddressAtOrigin or AddressAtDestination.

poBoxCode.title: Postal Address.PO Box Code
poBoxCode.description: Post office box. For example: P.O. Box 21.

streetText.title: Postal Address.Street Text
streetText.description: Street name and number. For example: Main Street, 100 Main Street.

Printer.title: Printer
Printer.description: A device for printing text or pictures or barcodes, especially one linked to a computer.

ProperName.title: Proper_ Name
ProperName.description: BDT with value constraints for proper, regular names (e.g. Individual Surname, Individual First Name, Company Name, etc.).

Qty.title: Quantity
Qty.description: A quantity is a counted number of non-monetary units, possibly including fractions

Rbd.title: RBD
Rbd.description: A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. For example: 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Discounted.

rbdCode.title: RBD.RBD Code
rbdCode.description: Code used to identify a particular RBD. For example: P, J, W, M.

RbdCode.title: RBD_ Code
RbdCode.description: Additional BDT to specify the RBD as defined in AIRIMP and SSIM.

RbdCodeEnum.title: RBD Code
RbdCodeEnum.description: Enumeration values of RBD Codes as per PADIS codeset 9800.

Scanner.title: Scanner
Scanner.description: A device that scans objects and converts them into or extracts digital data. E.g. document scanner, barcode reader, biometric scanner.

ScreeningAlarmCode.title: Screening Alarm_ Code
ScreeningAlarmCode.description: The screening alarm code of the bag incident

ScreeningAlarmCodeEnum.title: Screening Alarm Code
ScreeningAlarmCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Recommendation 1745 Attachment A Screening Alarm Reason Codes Valid Values: C - combination of dark alarm and explosives; D - Dark alarm; E - Explosives; N - no decision; T - time out

ScreeningCommentText.title: Screening Comment_ Text
ScreeningCommentText.description: Free text field up to 38 characters

ScreeningInstructionCode.title: Screening Instruction_ Code
ScreeningInstructionCode.description: The screening instruction code of the security control

ScreeningMethodCode.title: Screening Method_ Code
ScreeningMethodCode.description: The screening method code of the method interaction

ScreeningMethodCodeEnum.title: Screening Method Code
ScreeningMethodCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA Recommendation 1745 Attachment A Screening Method Codes Valid Values: AT - Advanced Technology screening method; EBD - Explosive bulk detection screening method; ETD - Explosive trace detection screening method; HAND - Hand Search screening method; XRAY - X-ray screening method

SeatAllocationExceptionCode.title: Seat Allocation Exception_ Code
SeatAllocationExceptionCode.description: Reasons for exceptions to allocating a seat at time of boarding.

SeatAllocationExceptionCodeEnum.title: Seat Allocation Exception Code
SeatAllocationExceptionCodeEnum.description: Lists the codes for exemption from seat allocation at issuance of boarding pass. Valid Values: GATE - A seat may be allocated at the gate if there is a spare seat for this standby boarding pass.; STBY - A seat may be allocated at the gate if there is a spare seat for this standby boarding pass.

SeatIdentifier.title: Seat_ Identifier
SeatIdentifier.description: The seat identifier of the service offering

SecurityControlNumber.title: Security Control_ Number
SecurityControlNumber.description: The security number of the security control.

SecurityScreeningEntityIdentifier.title: Security Screening Entity_ Identifier
SecurityScreeningEntityIdentifier.description: The result qualifier, identifying the entity that generated the Security Screening Result

SecurityScreeningInstructionCodeEnum.title: Security Screening Instruction Code
SecurityScreeningInstructionCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA recommended practice RP 1745 Attachment a screening instruction codes Valid Values: DEF - Default level of screening applies.; NON - No screening required conditional to applicable regulations.; PRE - Selected for increased level of screening; SEL - Selected for increased level of screening.

SecurityScreeningStatusCode.title: Security Screening Status_ Code
SecurityScreeningStatusCode.description: The security screening status code of the bag status

SecurityScreeningStatusCodeEnum.title: Security Screening Status Code
SecurityScreeningStatusCodeEnum.description: The codelist contents of IATA recommended practice RP 1745 Attachment a baggage security screening result codes Valid Values: CLR - Cleared, bag is cleared according to applicable regulations; REJ - Rejected, bag is rejected due to detected weapons, explosives or other dangerous devices; UCL - Unclear, bag is unclear due to indeterminate screening result

SegmentSecurityControls.title: Segment Security Controls
SegmentSecurityControls.description: A set of principles or procedures according to which something is done on a particular segment of travel.

authorityToLoadInd.title: Segment Security Controls.Authority To Load Indicator
authorityToLoadInd.description: The authority to load indicator of the security control. An authority security control is an official permission; sanction from a security context.

authorityToTransportInd.title: Segment Security Controls.Authority To Transport Indicator
authorityToTransportInd.description: The authority to transport indicator of the security control. An authority security control is an official permission; sanction from a security context.

bagDeleteRequestInd.title: Segment Security Controls.Bag Delete Request Indicator
bagDeleteRequestInd.description: A request by the airline to delete or mark as deleted the record for this bag as no longer expected for the flight.

bagRemovalRequestInd.title: Segment Security Controls.Bag Removal Request Indicator
bagRemovalRequestInd.description: A request by the airline to unload a loaded bag, Should be set with the authorization to load set to NO.

bagTagStatusCode.title: Segment Security Controls.Bag Tag Status Code
bagTagStatusCode.description: Determines whether bag is authorized to load

paxStatus.title: Each Segment Security Controls may in context of one and only one Passenger Segment
paxStatus.description: A transportation of a passenger on a Dated Operating Segment.

screeningInstructionCode.title: Segment Security Controls.Screening Instruction Code
screeningInstructionCode.description: The Screening Instruction of the security control. Security instruction control is a security control or a direction or order in a security context.

SegmentSecurityOutcomes.title: Segment Security Outcomes
SegmentSecurityOutcomes.description: A set of outcomes of applying Segment Security Controls to Baggage Process

containerSealedInd.title: Segment Security Outcomes.Container Sealed Indicator
containerSealedInd.description: The indicator of whether a container is sealed.

screeningDeviceIdentifier.title: Segment Security Outcomes.Screening Device Identifier
screeningDeviceIdentifier.description: Identifier, as defined by the manufacturer or airport, of the machine that has undertaken the screening activity and determined the screening result.

screeningEntityIdentifier.title: Segment Security Outcomes.Screening Entity Identifier
screeningEntityIdentifier.description: The result qualifier, identifying the entity that generated the Security Screening Result

screeningMethodCode.title: Segment Security Outcomes.Screening Method Code
screeningMethodCode.description: Code of the function interaction screening method.

screeningResultReason.title: Each Segment Security Outcomes may have one and only one Baggage Incident
screeningResultReason.description: An Event that occurs spontaneously about a bag, and to which the organization is required to respond.

screeningResultStatusCode.title: Segment Security Outcomes.Screening Result Status Code
screeningResultStatusCode.description: Code of the bag screening result status.

SegmentServiceOffer.title: Segment Service Offer
SegmentServiceOffer.description: An offer that applies to a particular segment of travel.

seatIdentifier.title: Segment Service Offer.Seat Identifier
seatIdentifier.description: The seat number of this service offer. Not filled in when jump seat, which is identified through the Baggage Segment Exception.

Station.title: Station
Station.description: A Location or facility where air or surface transportation originates, stops and/or terminates, and where passengers and/or cargo can be taken on or off.

iataLocationCode.title: Station.IATA Location Code
iataLocationCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

SupplementName.title: Supplement_ Name
SupplementName.description: BDT with value constraints for short supplements to proper names, such as Title, Suffix, etc.

SurfaceTransportIdentifier.title: Surface Transport_ Identifier
SurfaceTransportIdentifier.description: The identifier of a surface transport vehicle.

SurfaceTransportVehicle.title: Surface Transport Vehicle
SurfaceTransportVehicle.description: A means used for transporting people or goods, on land or water. E.g. train, bus, van, ship.

carriageMediumCode.title: Surface Transport Vehicle.Carriage Medium Code
carriageMediumCode.description: The code of the carriage medium, i.e. type of transport vehicle.

surfaceTransportIdentifier.title: Surface Transport Vehicle.Surface Transport Identifier
surfaceTransportIdentifier.description: The identifier of the surface transport vehicle.

Terminal.title: Terminal
Terminal.description: A departure and/or arrival building for aircraft, passengers or freight at a station for any transport mode.

Text.title: Text
Text.description: Text is a character string such as a finite set of characters generally in the form of words of a language.

TransponderIdentifier.title: Transponder_ Identifier
TransponderIdentifier.description: Unique Transponder identifier, known as T = TID for Transponder identification.

TransportArrival.title: Transport Arrival
TransportArrival.description: An action or process of arriving of a transport vehicle in any place or location. Superseded by Aircraft Arrival.

aircraftScheduledArrivalDateTime.title: Transport Arrival.Aircraft Scheduled Arrival Date Time
aircraftScheduledArrivalDateTime.description: Scheduled date and time of arrival of the aircraft at the terminal or departure gate at an airport.

arrivalStation.title: Each Transport Arrival may takes place at one and only one Station
arrivalStation.description: A Location or facility where air or surface transportation originates, stops and/or terminates, and where passengers and/or cargo can be taken on or off.

datedOperatingLeg.title: Each Transport Arrival must have one and only one Dated Operating Leg
datedOperatingLeg.description: A nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc. Superseded by Flight Leg.

TransportDep.title: Transport Departure
TransportDep.description: An action or process of leaving of a transport vehicle from any place or location. Superseded by Aircraft Departure.

aircraftScheduledDepDateTime.title: Transport Departure.Aircraft Scheduled Departure Date Time
aircraftScheduledDepDateTime.description: Scheduled date and time of departure of the aircraft at the terminal or departure gate at an airport.

datedOperatingLeg.title: Each Transport Departure must have one and only one Dated Operating Leg
datedOperatingLeg.description: A nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc. Superseded by Flight Leg.

depStation.title: Each Transport Departure may takes place at one and only one Station
depStation.description: A Location or facility where air or surface transportation originates, stops and/or terminates, and where passengers and/or cargo can be taken on or off.

Uld.title: ULD
Uld.description: A Unit Load Device is a load carrying device which interfaces directly with aircraft loading and restraint systems and meets all restraint requirements without the use of supplementary equipment. Examples include containers, pallets and pallet nets.

ownerCode.title: ULD.Owner Code
ownerCode.description: Specifies ULD Owner Code as per IATA ULD Regulations section 4

serialNumberIdentifier.title: ULD.Serial Number Identifier
serialNumberIdentifier.description: Specifies ULD Serial Number as per IATA ULD Regulations section 4

typeCode.title: ULD.Type Code
typeCode.description: Specifies ULD Type Code as per IATA ULD Regulations section 4

uldOwner.title: Each ULD may is owned by one and only one ULD Owner
uldOwner.description: A party may elect to own a fleet of ULD and make those available to industry

UldAllocation.title: ULD Allocation
UldAllocation.description: An allocation of a ULD to a specific set of legs and a load position in vehicle performing the legs

baggageProcess.title: Each ULD Allocation must be subject of one and only one Baggage Process
baggageProcess.description: A series of tasks or steps taken in order to achieve a particular end in the context of baggage logistics.

baggageState.title: Each ULD Allocation may results in one and only one Baggage Statuses
baggageState.description: A set of statuses of baggage at a particular time in a process.

carryingSegment.title: Each ULD Allocation must is part of one and only one Dated Operating Segment
carryingSegment.description: An operation between board point and any subsequent off point within the same flight designator. Could be one or more legs. Could also be used for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

classOfService.title: Each ULD Allocation may have one and only one RBD
classOfService.description: A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. For example: 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Discounted.

classOfServiceCode.title: ULD Allocation.Class Of Service Code
classOfServiceCode.description: Code used to identify a particular RBD. For example: P, J, W, M.

collection.title: Each ULD Allocation may is in one and only one Collection
collection.description: A collection reports when an item is (planned to be) collected at a facility potentially using a vehicle

commodityCode.title: ULD Allocation.Commodity Code
commodityCode.description: Code set used with ULDs for segregation of bags and/or cargo for efficient load and unload from the aircraft and subsequent ground operations. Load information codes, known also as commodity codes, are defined by but not limited to IATA Load Control - AHM 510, 1.1.

containerHandlingType.title: ULD Allocation.Container Handling Type
containerHandlingType.description: Container Handling Type expressed in free format 8 characters

delivery.title: Each ULD Allocation may is in one and only one Delivery
delivery.description: A delivery reports when an item is (planned to be) delivered at a facility potentially using a vehicle

securityControls.title: Each ULD Allocation may one and only one Segment Security Controls
securityControls.description: A set of principles or procedures according to which something is done on a particular segment of travel.

segmentSecurityOutcomes.title: Each ULD Allocation may results in one and only one Segment Security Outcomes
segmentSecurityOutcomes.description: A set of outcomes of applying Segment Security Controls to Baggage Process

uld.title: Each ULD Allocation must refers to one and only one ULD
uld.description: A Unit Load Device is a load carrying device which interfaces directly with aircraft loading and restraint systems and meets all restraint requirements without the use of supplementary equipment. Examples include containers, pallets and pallet nets.

uldLoadPosition.title: Each ULD Allocation may be held one and only one ULD Load Position
uldLoadPosition.description: A subdivision of a containerized/palletized compartment.

UldLoadPosition.title: ULD Load Position
UldLoadPosition.description: A subdivision of a containerized/palletized compartment.

holdCompartment.title: Each ULD Load Position may is in one and only one Hold Compartment
holdCompartment.description: A space designated within a hold that can be containerized/palletized or not.

uldLoadPositionIdentifier.title: ULD Load Position.ULD Load Position Identifier
uldLoadPositionIdentifier.description: Identifies a possible ULD position within the aircraft, using one of the patterns described in AHM505. E.g. A, BR, CDL, E3, 13,22L, 32P, 413, 1112O. May contain compartment number, row position, left-to-right position in a row.

UldLoadPositionIdentifier.title: ULD Load Position_ Identifier
UldLoadPositionIdentifier.description: Specifies a ULD Load Position identifier.

UldOwner.title: ULD Owner
UldOwner.description: A party may elect to own a fleet of ULD and make those available to industry

UldOwnerCodeEnum.title: ULD Owner Code
UldOwnerCodeEnum.description: Code set used with ULDs for segregation of bags for efficient load and unload from the aircraft and subsequent ground operations. The owner code consist of two alpha-numeric see attachment 'B' for list of currently assigned Owner Codes

UldSerialNumberIdentifier.title: ULD Serial Number_ Identifier
UldSerialNumberIdentifier.description: Specifies ULD Serial Number as per IATA ULD Regulations section 4

UldTypeCodeEnum.title: ULD Type Code
UldTypeCodeEnum.description: Code set used with ULDs for segregation of bags for efficient load and unload from the aircraft and subsequent ground operations. The type code consist of three characters, with the first character in alpha-numeric and the rest numeric

Uri.title: URI
Uri.description: A string of characters used to identify a resource. Such identification enables interaction with representations of the resource over a network, typically the World Wide Web, using specific protocols.

WeightMeasure.title: Weight_ Measure
WeightMeasure.description: A numeric value determining a weight along with the specified unit of measure.

unitCode.title: Weight_ Measure.Unit. Code
unitCode.description: The weight unit code of measure.

value.title: Weight_ Measure.Content
value.description: The numeric value determining a weight

WeightUnitCodeEnum.title: Weight Unit Code
WeightUnitCodeEnum.description: List of Weight Unit Codes. Subset of UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20. Valid Values: KGM - Kilogram; LBR - US Pound
